MAN.TITLE: sci2for
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: scilab function to Fortran routine conversion

PARAM_ITEM.PARAM_DESCRIPTION: : character string, the name of generated subroutine
: string, text of the subroutine Fortran code

DESCRIPTION.P: The elements of the list vtps give the type and dimensions of the input variables of the calling sequence and lvtps optionally gives the type and dimensions of the output variables. This last parameter is usefull if type and/or dimension inference cannot be able to determine the desired values.
These lists are structured as described below:
DESCRIPTION.DESCRIPTION_ITEM: : is a character string giving the type of the variable :
DESCRIPTION.P: Generated code may use routines of scilab libraries and some others whose source code may be found in <SCIDIR>/util/sci2for.f

ITEMIZE.label: REMARKS
ITEMIZE.P: This function is just a try. Only simple function may be translated. Many function calls have not yet Fortran equivalent, to add the translation of a new function call you may define a scilab function. whose name is f_<name of function>. see <SCIDIR>/macros/sci2for/f_*.sci files for examples.
may not appear in the function code.
